comments:
Hi there,

I installed the realease 2.0 on my linux machine but when I tried to launch 
Eclipse two problems occurred. The first problem is that a load library 
libcore_2_0_5.so couldn't be found. I searched the file with the find command 
and could find it:
./plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources.linux_2.0.0/os/linux/x86/libcore_2_0_5.so
It seems to be OK so the reason why it could not be found is not clear for me.

The second problem is a
    java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Widget
error. Both problems didn't occurre in the version I used before (f3).

Regards
Udo Klinkm?ller

Are you sure you downloaded the appropriate build of eclise for your windowing 
system?  Are you trying to use GTK or Motif?  You may have to supply an extra 
command line parameter to tell it which windowing system you are using:

./eclipse -ws gtk

or

./eclipse -ws motif

Hi,

Yes I'm sure that I downloaded the right build. Its name is eclipse-SDK-2.0-
linux-motif.zip. When I opened the bug report I added some additional 
information from the logging file where you can see the command line arguments 
and the error messages. I must use the Motif version of Eclipse because the 
GTK version doesn't launch in my environment (SuSe 7.3).

Regards
Udo

Veronika, I've seen this question before... I took a quick look on the newsgroup 
but the only answer I saw was to use "-ws motif".  Do you know what's happening 
here?

How did you unzip the eclipse download?  If you used winzip on a Windows 
machine and copied it to the linux machine or if you used jar, I have seen this 
cause problems with file permissions etc.  Also, did you unzip it as root or 
some other user than the user you are currently trying to open it as?  Did you 
see any CRC errors when unzipping it?  Did you install eclipse in an empty 
directory or did you unzip it over an existing installation?

Hi,

I installed Eclipse under the Linux OS using the unzip command. The 
destination directory was /opt and a directory named eclipse didn't exist 
before. If I installed Eclips with root rights I can't say anymore, because I 
removed Eclipse/R2 after I couldn't work with it. So I retried the 
installation as root some minutes ago. And now I must say it works. Very 
mysterious!

Regards
Udo Klinkm?ller

Closing.  It appears you somehow had a corrupt install.  Please reopen if you 
experience this again.
